body:
I am not exactly sure why this is needed, I followed the code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py

w/o it, I had a lot of problems getting the .so file to load properly
during runtime.
On Fri, May 6, 2016 at 3:15 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

> In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_cell_test.py
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2002#discussion_r62398199:
> 
> > @@ -23,6 +23,9 @@
> >  import tensorflow as tf
> > 
> > +tf.contrib.rnn.Load()
> 
> does this not happen by default upon rnn's _init_ ??
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2002/files/727e0c76bed212fdf240a221e577e1b1a86848d5#r62398199
body_html:
I am not exactly sure why this is needed, I followed the code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py

w/o it, I had a lot of problems getting the .so file to load properly
during runtime.
On Fri, May 6, 2016 at 3:15 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_cell_test.py
#2002 (comment):

@@ -23,6 +23,9 @@
import tensorflow as tf

+tf.contrib.rnn.Load()

does this not happen by default upon rnn's init ??

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/2002/files/727e0c76bed212fdf240a221e577e1b1a86848d5#r62398199
body_text:
I am not exactly sure why this is needed, I followed the code from:
tensorflow/contrib/tensor_forest/python/ops/training_ops.py
w/o it, I had a lot of problems getting the .so file to load properly
during runtime.
On Fri, May 6, 2016 at 3:15 PM, ebrevdo notifications@github.com wrote:

In tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/kernel_tests/rnn_cell_test.py
#2002 (comment):

@@ -23,6 +23,9 @@
import tensorflow as tf
+tf.contrib.rnn.Load()

does this not happen by default upon rnn's init ??
—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
